metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19492 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in cairo.trm in Gnuplot 5.2.5. This issue allows an attacker to conduct a buffer overflow with an arbitrary amount of data in the cairotrm_options function. This flaw is caused by a missing size check of an argument passed to the "set font" function. This issue occurs when the Gnuplot pngcairo terminal is used as a backend.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnuplot - 4.6.6-3ubuntu0.1
gnuplot-data - 4.6.6-3ubuntu0.1
gnuplot-nox - 4.6.6-3ubuntu0.1
gnuplot-qt - 4.6.6-3ubuntu0.1
gnuplot-tex - 4.6.6-3ubuntu0.1
gnuplot-x11 - 4.6.6-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnuplot package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.6.6-3ubuntu0.1').
gnuplot5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
